column4: can someone help me.. my xorg.0.log tels me that hey cannot load module nvidea.. now gnome doesn't start...
how did you installed the nv drivers?
it works with the latest nv drivers
i did not asked that; i asked how did you installed those drivers
i downloaded the drivers from the nvidia site and installed them...
well that explains... everytime there is a kernel or xorg upgrade you have to reinstall the drivers
.. hmm ok.. i will try that
i run the installer as we speak and tells me that there is already a driver installed... that doesn't matter?
tell it to procceed anyway
I have my doubts... whe shall see. ;)
Gnome runs ageain... thanks for that... but i think my change in xorg.conf is gone...

thanks :D ... i am trying to get my HD movies run smooth... when i run them my processor is getting 100%.. so i have to make a change in xorg.conf.. option "NoFlip" "1" <-- is see this in my screen section now..
never used that option...
it's just not stable.. because my mouse is freezing sometimes and my movies keep playing on 100% cpu.. thats @$%%^^
i've got it ithnik
i use Gnome Mplayer now
50 % cpu.
ok
hmm to fast.. i't 100% now.. :(
ok i've nailed it!
i installed the latest nvidia drivers.. 270.18 beta
yeah i am very very pleased with this
